verses.text: Furthermore Elihu answered and said ,
Hear my words , O ye wise \add men;\add* and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.
For the ear trieth words , as the mouth tasteth meat.\f + \fr 34.3 \ft mouth: Heb. palate\f*
Let us choose to us judgment : let us know among ourselves what \add is\add* good.
For Job hath said , I am righteous : and God hath taken away my judgment.
Should I lie against my right ? my wound \add is\add* incurable without transgression.\f + \fr 34.6 \ft my wound: Heb. mine arrow\f*
What man \add is\add* like Job , \add who\add* drinketh up scorning like water ?
Which goeth in company with the workers of iniquity , and walketh with wicked men.
For he hath said , It profiteth a man nothing that he should delight himself with God. \p

Therefore hearken unto me, ye men of understanding : far be it from God , \add that he should do\add* wickedness ; and \add from\add* the Almighty , \add that he should commit\add* iniquity.\f + \fr 34.10 \ft men…: Heb. men of heart\f*
For the work of a man shall he render unto him, and cause every man to find according to \add his\add* ways.
Yea, surely God will not do wickedly , neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.
Who hath given him a charge over the earth ? or who hath disposed the whole world ?\f + \fr 34.13 \ft the whole: Heb. all of it?\f*
If he set his heart upon man, \add if\add* he gather unto himself his spirit and his breath ;\f + \fr 34.14 \ft man: Heb. him\f*
All flesh shall perish together , and man shall turn again unto dust. \p
If now \add thou hast\add* understanding , hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.
Shall even he that hateth right govern ? and wilt thou condemn him that is most just ?\f + \fr 34.17 \ft govern: Heb. bind?\f*
\add Is it fit\add* to say to a king , \add Thou art\add* wicked ? \add and\add* to princes , \add Ye are\add* ungodly ?
\add How much less to him\add* that accepteth not the persons of princes , nor regardeth the rich more than the poor ? for they all \add are\add* the work of his hands.

In a moment shall they die , and the people shall be troubled at midnight , and pass away : and the mighty shall be taken away without hand.\f + \fr 34.20 \ft the mighty…: Heb. they shall take away the mighty\f*
For his eyes \add are\add* upon the ways of man , and he seeth all his goings.
\add There is\add* no darkness , nor shadow of death , where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.
For he will not lay upon man more \add than right;\add* that he should enter into judgment with God.\f + \fr 34.23 \ft enter: Heb. go\f*
He shall break in pieces mighty men without number , and set others in their stead.\f + \fr 34.24 \ft number: Heb. searching out\f*
Therefore he knoweth their works , and he overturneth \add them\add* in the night , so that they are destroyed.\f + \fr 34.25 \ft destroyed: Heb. crushed\f*
He striketh them as wicked men in the open sight of others;\f + \fr 34.26 \ft open…: Heb. place of beholders\f*
Because they turned back from him , and would not consider any of his ways :\f + \fr 34.27 \ft him: Heb. after him\f*
So that they cause the cry of the poor to come unto him, and he heareth the cry of the afflicted.
When he giveth quietness , who then can make trouble ? and when he hideth \add his\add* face , who then can behold him? whether \add it be done\add* against a nation , or against a man only :
That the hypocrite reign not, lest the people be ensnared. \p
Surely it is meet to be said unto God , I have borne \add chastisement\add*, I will not offend \add any more:\add*
\add That which\add* I see not teach thou me: if I have done iniquity , I will do no more.

\add Should it be\add* according to thy mind? he will recompense it, whether thou refuse , or whether thou choose ; and not I: therefore speak what thou knowest.\f + \fr 34.33 \ft according…: Heb. from with thee?\f*
Let men of understanding tell me, and let a wise man hearken unto me.\f + \fr 34.34 \ft of…: Heb. of heart\f*
Job hath spoken without knowledge , and his words \add were\add* without wisdom.
My desire \add is that\add* Job may be tried unto the end because of \add his\add* answers for wicked men.\f + \fr 34.36 \ft My…: or, My father, let Job be tried\f*
For he addeth rebellion unto his sin , he clappeth \add his hands\add* among us, and multiplieth his words against God.
